loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de cinquante-un ans. Elle est mariée à un infirmier. Elle a trois enfants, dont deux sont à l’école. Le premier a vingt-cinq ans et le dernier dix-huit ans.  
La cliente travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1993. Elle vend les alimentations générale et du charbon de bois pour ses clients à sa maison. Elle a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d'améliorer le commerce(en achetant plus de marchandises). Avec ses profits supplémentaires, elle voudrait acheter un terrain. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait achever l`avancement et la récréation des autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit une condition de vie améliorée.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 51-year-old woman who is married to a health care worker. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The first child is 25 years old, and the last is 18. 

This client has been working as a retailer since 1003, She sells grocery items and charcoal out of her house. 

She has requested her first loan from WAGES for improving her business (by buying more merchandise). With the extra profits, she would like to buy a plot of land. 

In the next few years, AFiwa would like to be successful promoting and creating more stores. She says that she will use the profits for better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy luchadora y siempre buscar salir adelante junto con hijo. Paola hace aproximadamente 2 años se encontraba trabajando en un taller de elaboración de piñatas, avisos en poliestireno expandido, entre otros productos más, y debido a que su jefe abandonó el municipio, le dejó la clientela que atendía para que ella la siga satisfaciendo. Es por esto que decidió montar su propio taller de elaboración de productos en poliestireno expandido donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos, pero su producto más vendido son las piñatas de cumpleaños. Paola gracias a este trabajo, ha podido salir adelante como madre soltera cabeza de familia, pues tiene un hijo de 3 años a quien su padre nunca ha aportado ninguna ayuda. Debido a que su taller lo montó con muy bajo capital, Paola no cuenta con todas las herramientas de trabajo necesarias, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de un compresor con aerógrafo para pintar sus productos con mayor calidad.
Paola de esta manera podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad en sus productos, por lo que aumentará sus ventas considerablemente. Además, Paola espera que con su taller mejor dotado de las herramientas necesarias, pueda ser más atractivo para nuevos clientes y pueda así sacarlo adelante. Paola sueña con tener un gran taller y con que su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Paola is a person who is characterized by being a fighter and is always looking to get ahead with her son. About two years ago, she was working in a shop making piñatas, advertisements on expanded polystyrene, and other products.  Since her boss left the city, he left her the clientele that he attended to she could keep serving them.  This is why she decided to start her own shop making products on expanded polystyrene, and she offers a big variety of products.  Her most-sold product is birthday piñatas.  Thanks to this job, Paola has been able to get ahead as a single mother and head of the family.  She has a 3-year-old son whose father has never supported him with any help.  Since she started her business with very little capital, Paola doesn't have all of the necessary tools to do her job.  This is why she is looking for a loan that will offer her the possibility of buying a compressor with an airbrush so she can paint her products with better quality.

In this way, Paola will be able to offer her customers a better quality in her products, which will increase her sales considerably.  Additionally, Paola hopes to equip her store with the necessary tools so it can be more attractive for new customers so she can progress with her business.  Paola dreams about having a big shop so her son can have a better quality of life and access to a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a compressor with an airbrush to paint her products with better quality.

loans.name: Lenilia

texts.en:
Lenilia is 54 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Lenilia works hard to provide for her family.  She sells nipa (woven palm mats use for house construction and repair) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to sell.

Lenilia has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling nipa for 14 years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.  Lenilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more nipa to sell

loans.name: Lodely

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Lodely works hard to support her family.  She has a computer games business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lodely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance for her computer games  business.

Lodely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance

loans.name: Goussivi

texts.fr:
Goussivi est une femme âgée de cinquante-deux ans. Elle est mariée à un photographe. Elle a quatre enfants, tous sont encore à l’école. Le premier a dix-huit ans et le dernier huit ans.  
La cliente travaille comme revendeuse de bazins (tissu Sénégalais) depuis 2002. Elle vend des bazins et des produits de mercerie pour ses clients dans un quartier de Lomé.
Elle a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins pour élargir son stock. Si possible, elle veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour élargir l`activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Goussivi voudrait vendre des pagnes aussi que des bazins. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d`aider ses enfants à aller encore plus l`école en leur trouvant un répétiteur
texts.en:
Goussivi is a 52-year-old woman who is married to a photographer. She has four children, all still in school. The first child is 18 years old, and the last is 8. 

This client has been working as a retailer of damask cloth (Senegalese fabric) since 2002. She sells damask and sewing supplies to her customers in a district in Lomé. 

She has requested her first loan from WAGES for buying some damask cloth in order to expand her inventory. If possible, she wants to use her extra profits for expanding her business. 

In the next few years, Goussivi would like to sell <i>pagnes<i/> (colorful West African cloth), as well as damask. She say she will use the profits to help her children with more schooling by finding a tutor for them.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Paulette Héloïse

texts.fr: Paulette Héloïse est mariée et mère de 3 enfants avec 38 ans d'âge . Elle a une baraque dans laquelle elle vend de la nourriture principalement la sauce graine . Elle a nécessité  un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle constitués de conducteurs de taxi-motos qui représentent la majorité de la populations aussi pour mieux rentabiliser son profit et d'améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en: Paulette Héloïse, aged 38, is a married mother of three children. She has a stand in which she sells food, mainly sauces made from seeds or beans. She needed financing from Finadev with the aim of satisfying the demands of her customers, who are composed of <i>moto<i/> taxi drivers who represent the majority of the population. Her aim is also to make her business more profitable and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of palm nuts and 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila, is married and has 2 children. She is 32 years old, and resides at Tinotongan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Mila owns a plot of land where she raises crops for their living.  She's been 5 years in this business.  Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 15,000PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops. In 2011, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Mila wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el sector de Laynas, a 10 minutos de La Matanza, con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Isabel destaca por ser una cliente seria y muy respetuosa.
Como en la gran parte del norte del Perú, Isabel es una mujer que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora, especialmente en el sector de Laynas.
El préstamo asciende a 1008 nuevos soles, el cual solicita para invertirlo en su negocio, específicamente para la compra de maíz duro y para la compra de accesorios para la venta de la chicha, tales como jarras, ollas, baldes , entre otros, para que de esa manera tenga mejores ingresos y por ende una mejor condición de vida en la jurisdicción.
El mercado es bueno para este tipo de negocio, ya que en su mayoría los pobladores exclusivamente las amas de casa son las que tienen este tipo de negocio, para ello necesita invertir y de esa manera perciba buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 49 year old married woman. She has three sons. She lives in her own house in the Laynas sector, 10 minutes from La Matanza. She has good personal and work references. Isabel stands out as a serious and very respectful client of Kiva's partner. 

Isabel earns her living making and selling a popular beverage known as chicha de jora, a common activity in most of northern Perú, especially in the Laynas sector. 

Isabel's loan is 1008 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN). She is requesting the loan in order to invest it in her business, specifically in the purchase of hard corn and accessories for the sale of the chicha such as jars, pans and buckets, among other items. In this way she will improve her earnings and as a result, achieve better quality of life. 

The market is good for this type of business. Many of the housewives of the area make their living in this type of business. To do so, it is necessary to invest in order to earn good profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials for the preparation of chicha, a popular beverage.

loans.name: Ejido De Mayorazgo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Ejido de Mayorazgo" esta conformado por tres mujeres y dos hombres todas son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables el nombre lo eligieron porque asi se llama el lugar donde viven, la comunidda es muy tranquila cuenta con todos los servicios com escuelas, centro de salud, luz, drenaje, agua potable etc. En fin todos los vecinos de la locacidad tienen acceso a los servicios.
Don Federico quien es el representante del grupo cuenta que tiene 38 años de edad esta casado desde hace 17 años con sus esposa Alejandra juntos han procreado 4 niños 3 de ellos son los que aun estudian, Alexa de 3 años, Jonatahan de 8 años se encuentra en primaria, Ivan de 15 años se encuentra en secundaria.
Don Federico se dedica a la crianza de borregos  desde hace 15 años comenta que la actviadad la inicio porque la aprendio de su papa esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comprar 5 borregos y lo que e quede sera para pastura, maiz y alimento.
Nos comenta que una de sus dificultades mas grandes es cuando no tiene el recurso necesario para comprar alimento y don Federico cree que es una de las razones por las cuales sus borregos se enferman cuando esto le sucede a don Federico tiene que comprar desparacitantes y vaitaminas para aplicarselos a borregos que tiene en casa.
"A mi el credito me va a benefiar de mucho porque podre comprar maiz que mucha falta le hace ya que este año pues casi no se levanto la cosecha del maiz"
Esta vez la meta de Don Federico es seguir creciendo la actividad tener mas borregos y de buena caliadad para que las ganacias sean cada vez mejores y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Don Federico y el resto del grupo estan muy agradecidos con el credito otorgado ya que podran invertir en sus respectivas actividades. Maria Elidia, Josefina y Carolina invertiran en borregos mientras que Don Jose otro integrante del grupo comprara Pollos.
texts.en:
The group, "Ejido de Mayorazgo," is made up of three women and two men, all of whom are hard-working and responsible people.  They chose their name because of the place where they live.  The community is peaceful and has all services like schools, a health center, electricity, drainage, potable water, etc.  All of the people in the area have access to these services.

Federico is the representative of the group.  He is 38 and has been married to his wife, Alejandra, for 17 years.  Together they have 4 children, 3 of whom are in school.  Alexa is 3, Jonathan is 8 and in elementary school, and Ivan is 15 and in high school.

Federico has made a living raising sheep for more 15 years.  He tells us that he started this business because he learned it from his father.  He has requested a loan to buy 5 lambs, and he will use the rest to buy fodder, corn, and feed.

He tells us that one of his biggest difficulties is when he doesn't have the necessary resources to buy feed. Federico believes that this is one of the reasons his sheep get sick, and when this happens, Federico has to buy anti-parasitics and vitamins to apply to the sheep. 

He says, "The loan is going to benefit me a lot because I will be able to buy corn.  I need this because this year the corn harvest wasn't very good."

This time, Federico's goal is to keep growing his business to have more sheep that are good quality so his profits will get better and he can improve his family's quality of life.  Federico and the rest of the group are very thankful for the loan that is being offered to them so they can invest it in their respective activivities.  Maria Elidia, Josefina, and Carolina will invest in their sheep while Jose will invest in chickens.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Wafaa has owned a beauty salon since 2010 and has 16 years of experience in this field.  Wafaa is a hardworking woman.  She puts a great effort into helping her husband to make their living.

She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles.  Her previous loan helped a lot in buying necessary tools and machines for her business. Today, Wafaa is applying for an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner loan in order to take care of necessary maintenance to the salon's door & to increase her stock of beauty cosmetics that she uses and sells to customers.  Wafaa hopes to start an additional business that has to deal with sleeping clothes and underwear, in the future.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance of the salon's door & to increase stock of beauty products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 53 years old and is married.  She has 5 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig.  Francisca has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
This is Cyril, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a vendor, and she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies.  Cyril operates a market stall in the community market. She sells vegetables and other items to cook.  She buys a quantity of vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sells them by the kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cyril dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Finafa Virginie

texts.fr: Finafa Virginie est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle commercialise des divers. En vue d'achalander son stock et d'avoir un grand nombre de profit. Elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et surtout des enfants.
texts.en: Finafa Virginie is 38 years old and a married mother of three children. She markets a variety of goods. With the aim of stocking up and having larger profits, she is requesting financing from Finadev to meet her day-to-day needs and especially those of her children.

loans.use: to buy containers of ointment, perfumes, and hair straightener

loans.name: Lomela

texts.en:
Lomela is 50 years old and is married.  She has 3 children who are in school.  Lomela is in the agricultural business, fattening  pigs.  Lomela requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.  Lomela has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lomela would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additioanl feed for her pigs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela works hard to support her family.  She is married, and sells dried fish in the Philippines.  Angela requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.  Angela has been in this business for 10 years now.  In the future, Angela would like to save enough to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 50 years old and is married.  She has 3 children.  Crisanta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Crisanta has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling copra.  Crisanta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Monbereola

texts.fr: Monbéréola est mariée, âgée de 62 ans et mère de 05 enfants. Elle commercialise des glacieres,des ustensiles de cuisine et des chaussures en plus de bijoux. Elle a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev  pour améliorer la qualité de ses ustensils afin de fidéliser la clientèle et participer au bonheur de sa famille.
texts.en: Monbéréola, aged 62, is the mother of five children. She markets insulated containers (coolers), kitchen utensils, shoes, and jewelry too. She obtained financing from Finadev for improving the quality of her utensils in order to earn the loyalty of her customers and to contribute to her family's happiness.

loans.use: to buy 2 sets of nested bowls, 3 sets of insulated containers, and a dozen shoes

loans.name: Dasa

texts.en:
Dasa is married and has 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Dasa is 46 years old, and has 3 children who are in school.

Dasa grows vegetables in the Philippines. Dasa requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase seeds and to pay for laborer's salaries on her vegetable farm.  Dasa has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Dasa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pay for laborers' salaries on her vegetable farm

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in the wet market.

Emma has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ester requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business. She has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Ester would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 39 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

Girlie runs a business buying and selling copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Girlie has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jose Ezequias

texts.es:
José, esta motivado por un nuevo préstamo, pues continua el plan de mejorar la vivienda, reconstruyendo el techo, para eso necesita la comprar tejas, madera, lamina, polines, que son los necesarios para instalar nuevamente el techo, con este préstamo su vivienda estará en mejores condiciones para albergar a su familia.
El préstamo anterior tambien lo invirtió en la vivienda, por lo que a través de préstamos está mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: José is motivated to get a new loan, because he continues with the plan to improve his house by re-building the roof, for this he needs to buy tile, wood, metal sheets, studs, that are necessary to install a new roof, with this loan his house will be in better conditions to accommodate his family.  The previous loan was also invested in his house, so through loans he is improving his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to buy tile, wood, metal sheets, studs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 50-year-old married woman with four children, ages 10, 15, 20, and 24. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Erlinda has been involved in farming for twenty-one years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Erlinda and her husband work together to sustain their family. 

Erlinda requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds. She hopes that her income will enable her to sustain her children's education and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 28-year-old married man. He has a son who is two years old. He describes himself to be honest and obedient. 

He operates a retail store where he sells cakes and doughnuts. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a densely populated busy town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy an oven. His business goal is to run a bakery within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have stable income.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Mayra Magaly

texts.es:
Mayra está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque  considera  que de esta manera lograra salir adelante con su negocio, ella comprara maíz, aceite, gas, repollo, chicharrón y refrescos, para mantener lo necesario para atender a los clientes.
El préstamo anterior le permitió tener mayor capacidad para atender la demanda y también generar mayor ingreso para cubrir las necesidades.
texts.en: Mayra is requesting a new loan because she considers that this way she will be able to get ahead with her business, she will buy corn, oil, gas, cabbage, cracklings and soft drinks to have everything she needs to serve her clients.  The previous loan allowed her to have more capacity to serve the demand and generate more income to cover her needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, gas, cabbage, cracklings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 15 años, en todo este tiempo ella ha podido aprender como ser mejor madre y ser mejor negociante, ella se dedica la venta de Flores y hace arreglos florales, esta muy satisfecha porque con las capacitaciones le ayudan a como tratar al cliente y ahora  después de 15 años sigue firme y progresando. Ahora con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de flores.
texts.en: Julia is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water) Communal Bank. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 15 years, and during all this time she has been able to learn how to be a good mother and a better retailer. She sells flowers and she also makes floral arrangements. She is very pleased because the seminars help her to better tend to her customers, and now after 15 years she carries on steady and she keeps on growing. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy more flowers.

loans.use: To buy flowers.

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Everlides de 43 años de edad,es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 15 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en adultos exitosos; ella se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, actividad aprendida desde hace 17 años, de su esposo,  a quien ayudaba  los fines de semanas, pues los días hábiles, se encontraba trabajado como empleada, de una organización gubernamental en su departamento. En esa época Everlides, generó un mercado entre compañeras de trabajo y gradualmente fue extendiéndose;  cuando dejo de ser empleada y se dedicó a apoyar la microempresa familiar, logró el fortalecimiento de sus ventas por docenas a pequeños comerciantes y a empleadas de otras empresas. En la actualidad en esta microempresa trabajan ella, su esposo y una empleada y no tiene una máquina guarnecedora, por eso debe terciarizar el servicio y pagar un poco más por esta tarea. Su meta es lograr ampliar su negocio, mejorar su proceso productivo y aumentar el volumen de compras,  para obtener descuentos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una máquina guarnecedora y el saldo lo invertirá en plantillas, cuero y pegante, para hacer nuevos diseños y ofrecerlos al mercado, en el que cumplirá su exigencia de modernidad, justificando así el ´éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Everlides is 43 years old. She is married and has two children ages 13 and 15, and her dream is to see them become successful adults. She makes shoes, an occupation she learned 17 years ago from her husband, whom she helped on weekends, as on weekdays she worked an an employee of a government organization in her region.

At that time, Everlides created a market among her co-workers, and it gradually expanded. When she stopped being an employee she worked helping in the family small business, and succeeded in building up their sales, which they do by the dozen, to small merchants and to employees of other companies. 

Currently, she, her husband, and one employee work in the business, and they don't have an industrial sewing machine. That's why they have to outsource the service, and pay a bit more for this job.

Her goal is to succeed in expanding their business, improve their production process, and increase the volume of their purchases in order to get discounts. 

This is why why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy an industrial sewing machine, and invest the balance in insoles, leather and glue, in order to make new designs and market them. This way she will meet her requirement for modernity,  justifying in this way the investment.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine, and invest the balance in insoles, leather and glue.

loans.name: Evergista

texts.en:
Evergista is 46 years old.  She is a married woman and has three children, ages 16, 17, and 20. Evergista is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Evergista's husband is also a farmer.

Evergista requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers. She hopes for her business to grow, which would help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 49-year-old married man. He has six children, ranging in age from 11 year to 30 years old. He describes himself as a visionary and determined man. 

Jonathan operates a retail stall where he sells clothes such as t-shirts, trousers, and jackets. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. His business goal is to run another clothes retail store within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He is 58 years old, married, and has 10 children. 

Leonardo plants rice crops on his land and sells his harvest at the market. He also owns a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages. Leonardo works hard to sustain his family. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries. He hopes to expand his rice farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She is married and has seven children. 

Erlinda sells home-use products in her little store so as to support her family's daily basic needs. For seven years, she has continually managed her store and she earns PHP 5,000 a month from this. Since 2007, Erlinda has been a member of GDMPC. Now she needs to obtain more products to sell, so she took a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC.. She is hoping for business progress and expansion.

loans.use: to obtain more products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Tiburciana

texts.es: Tiburciana es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, continua con la venta de anticuchos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 7 años, con Finca Perú aprendió a ser mas responsable y no dejarse vencer por la dificultades, trabaja sola y trata que a su familia no le falte nada, gracias a los préstamos recibidos pudo ayudarles a sus hijos con sus estudios, y ahora sigue trabajado para que todo le salga bien. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de carne y papa.
texts.en: Tiburciana is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water) Communal Bank . She continues selling anticuchos (grilled meat on a stick), and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 7 years. Thanks to Finca Peru she has learned how to be more responsible and not to be discouraged by difficulties. She works alone and she tries to provide everything for her family so that they find themselves not in need. Thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to pay for the education of her children, and she now keeps on working so that everything goes well for her. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy meat and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Eduardo José

texts.es: Eduardo  con su credikiva anterior compró al por mayor accesorios y repuestos de teléfonos celulares, que vendió y ganó dinero con esta venta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará más repuestos y accesorios de teléfonos celulares en mayor volumen, los cuales importará directamente de la China. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Es muy noble la labor que desarrollan de apoyar en todo el mundo a pequeños empresarios que solo necesitan un préstamo para salir adelante con sus familias. “
texts.en: With his last 'credikiva' (loan from Kiva), Eduardo purchased at wholesale cell phone accessories and replacement parts which he then sold, earning money from the sale. At present, he is applying for another Kiva loan, with which he will buy more cell phone parts and accessories in larger volume, that he will import directly from China. His message to Kiva investors is the following: "You are doing very noble work to help small entreprenuers all over the world who just need a loan to advance their families!"

loans.use: purchase more replacement parts and cellular phone accessories in larger volume.

loans.name: Haylen

texts.en:
Haylen is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Haylen is 26 years old and has one child who is in school.

Haylen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Haylen has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yabo Adjikè Nicole

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Nicole est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a un emplacement ou elle vend des beignets de l'igname frite auxquels elle associe le commerce de tissus et amuse-gueule. Elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son stock et de maximiser son profit pour le bonheur de la famille.
texts.en: Nicole is 45 years old, married and the mother of three. She has a stand where she sells yam fritters. In addition, she sells cloth and snacks. She is seeking a loan from Finadev in order to expand her stock and maximize her revenues, to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy one  bag of yams, one  basket of beans,10  pieces of cloth, two bunches of bananas

loans.name: Doris Xiomara

texts.es:
Doris solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda como productos enlatados, aceite, embutidos, pollo, condimentos, esto le permitirá ofrecer a los clientes variedad de producto para mantener la preferencia de ellos.
Con el préstamo anterior logro comprar mercadería surtir el negocio aumentar las ganancias, actualmente su familia se encuentra estable.
texts.en: Doris requests a new loan to buy more products for her store such as canned products, oil, sausages, chicken and spices, this will allow her to offer her clients a variety of products to keep them preferring her business.  With the previous loan she was able to buy merchandise and stock the business to increase her profit, currently her family is in a stable condition.

loans.use: to buy canned products, oil, sausages, chicken and spices.

loans.name: Marcela Ivania

texts.es:
Marcela, desea invertir más en el negocio ya que las ventas han aumentado y tiene la oportunidad para aumentar sus ganancias solicita el préstamo para la compra de quesillo, maíz, chicharrón, aceite, con los que espera mejorar la producción.
El negocio de marcela a mejorado debido a la inversión del préstamo anterior  creciendo poco a poco y estabilizando su condición familiar.
texts.en:
Marcela wants to invest more in her business because sales have grown and she has the opportunity to increase her income so she requests a loan to buy cheese, corn, cracklings and oil with which she hopes to have better production.
Marcela's business is better due to the previous loan investment growing little by little and stabilizing her family's condition.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, cracklings and oil.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, se dedica a la venta de cereales y verduras, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, lo que mas valora es el ahorro y gracias a ello, ahora sus hijos terminaron de estudiar, Paulina trabaja mucho y trata de hacer bien las cosa y de invertir bien para que su negocio pueda progresar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras y cereales.
texts.en: Paulina is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water) Communal Bank. She sells cereals and vegetables. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years, and what she mostly values are the savings, thanks to which her children have been able to complete their studies. Paulina works hard and she tries to make things right and to make good investments so that her activity can grow. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine de 25 años,  es una joven casada que tiene un hijo en la edad de 4 años. Ella se desempeña en una actividad, generadora de ingresos, como lo es la decoración y elaboración de productos con sus propias manos en material foamy, además de vender fantasías e insumos para trabajar con artesanías. Esta actividad la inició porque siendo profesora de manualidades,  sus estudiantes tenían la necesidad de comprar las materias primas para trabajar en sus clases, así fue que se ideó la forma de vendérselas ella misma y también de comercializar los productos que sabia hacer. Con sus ahorros empezó la tarea y poco a poco   agregó la venta de insumos artesanales, hasta que finalmente adicionó productos de miscelánea cuando compró su primera vitrina en una oportunidad ofrecida por una amiga. Su padre la apoyó, pues con su espíritu visionario, le ofreció su casa bien ubicada, para que diera clases de artesanías y sirviera a su vez como un punto comercial, donde vender insumos y todo lo que para  la población objeto, fuera su necesidad; Katherine compró poco a poco su infraestructura, todo esto con créditos y así logró tener mas exhibidores y surtirlos. En la actualidad además de su negocio comercial, ofrece el servicio de fotocopiaje y venta de minutos a celulares. Su meta es continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y fomentar para su hijo un futuro lleno de muchos éxitos. Su mayor desafío ante la creciente clientela, es que su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para las expectativas que ella tiene y este es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos artesanles útiles escolares, chancletas, desechables, cosméticos y mercancía variada, para responder a su clientela y esto es lo que hace que su inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Katherine is a 25-year-old married woman with a 4-year-old son. She has undertaken an activity to produce income, which is making and decorating  products by hand from a foamy material. She also sells novelty items and craft supplies. She started this business because, as the craft instructor, she realized her students needed to buy primary materials.It occurred to her that she could sell the supplies and also the products she learned to make. 

With her savings, she started the business and slowly added sales of handicraft supplies. She eventually added miscellaneous items when she bought her first showcase in an opportunity offered by a friend. Her father helped her. With his visionary spirit, he offered her his well-located house so that she could give handicraft classes. She also uses it as a commercial space, where she sells supplies and all the things the local population needs. 

Katherine bought the infrastructure little by little on credit. In this way, she was able to buy more display cases and stock them. In addition to her business, she offers photocopying and sells cellular minutes. Her goal is to continue growing her business and building a future full of successes for her son. Her major challenge, given her growing clientele, is that her working capital turnover is insufficient to meet her expectations.This is why she came to Kiva credit. With a first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she will buy craft supplies, school supplies, sandals, disposables, cosmetics and other merchandise to meet the needs of her customers. This is what will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to buy craft supplies, school supplies, sandals, disposables, cosmetics and other merchandise.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 54 años, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 15 años, es madre de 2 hijos, tiene una tienda de venta de artesanía y joyería, ella empezó como ambulante, el negocio no era nada fácil, pero con su perseverancia ella pudo construir su casa y que su familia pueda salir adelante, su satisfacción es haber ayudado a su hijo terminar su segunda profesión. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de artesanía para la Semana Santa.
texts.en: Maruja is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water) Communal Bank, she is 54 years old, she has two children and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 15 years. She runs a shop where she sells craftsmanship and jewel. She started as a street vendor, and the activity was not at all easy, but thanks to her perseverance she has succeeded in buying a house and to provide for her family. She is pleased to have helped her son completing his studies for a second profession. The loan she is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of craftsmanship for the Holy Week.

loans.use: To buy craftsmanship for the Holy Week.

loans.name: Ojo De Agua Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama "Ojo de Agua" esta conformado por las señoras Antonia y Azucena van a comprar con su préstamo telas de varios colores, encajes por tubo e hilos, la señora Victoria va a comprar bandas, aceite para mantenimiento de sus maquinas, la señora Teresa va a comprar globos metálicos, la señora Alma Delia va a comprar lonas y tubos, la señora Raquel va a comprar refrescos, detergente, leche, azúcar, huevo, bimbo, sabritas. La señora Raquel tiene 50 años de edad, ella estudio para secretaria ejecutiva, ella es casada ella tiene 2 hijos varones uno mayor de edad ya no estudia y el otro joven estudia bachilleres, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar refrescos, jabón, azúcar, huevo, leche, aceite, papel higiénico, chiles en vinagre, ella está iniciando en la tienda de abarrotes se la traspaso su cuñado, su negocio es importante porque es una fuente de ingresos y se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, a ella le gusta atender a los clientes amablemente, sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar la tienda tenerla bien surtida y que su hijo se supere que tenga una carrera. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos nos dan la oportunidad de realizarnos en los negocios y las familias de lograr nuestras metas y perspectivas de vida y que sigan apoyando con sus préstamos a más personas que lo necesitan”.
texts.en: This community bank is called, "Ojo de Agua," and includes Antonia and Azucena, who are going to use their loan to buy fabric in various colors, lace by the tube, and thread.  Victoria is going to buy belts and oil to maintain her machines.  Teresa is going to buy mylar balloons.  Alma Delia is going to buy canvases and tubes.  Raquel is going to buy soft drinks, detergent, milk, sugar, eggs, Bimbo brand bread, and Sabritas brand snacks.  Raquel is 50.  She studied to be an administrative assistant.  She is married and has two sons.  One is an adult and isn't in school anymore.  The other is in college. She has a grocery store.  She requested the loan to buy soft drinks, soap, sugar, eggs, milk, oil, toilet paper, and chilis in vinegar.  She is starting a grocery store that her brother-in-law transferred to her.  Her business is important because it is a source of income, and she is proud of having her own business.  She likes to attend to her customers in a friendly manner.  Her hopes and dreams are to expand her store and to have it well-stocked and that her son betters himself and has a career.  The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for the loans that give us the opportunity to accomplish ourselves in our businesses and our families and to reach our goals and life outlooks.  We hope you keep supporting the people who most need it with loans."

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, sugar, eggs, milk, oil, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 56 years old and married with 5 children.

Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, snacks, and coffee.

Betty has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Betty aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant at the public market.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, snacks, and coffee.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo es un hombre de 65 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente en el caserío Monteverde Bajo, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Adolfo es la crianza de ganado ovino, caprino y pavos, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Adicionalmente, Adolfo es agricultor teniendo una chacra propia, en la cual tiene cultivos de mango en producción.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor.
texts.en: Adolfo is a 65-year-old man, has a common law partner and doesn't have children that depend of him.  He lives in a house he owns with his partner in the Monteverde Bajo neighborhood, district of Tambogrande.  He lives in the rural area of the district but counts with electricity service.  The activity that Adolfo works on is raising livestock such as sheep, goats and turkeys that once they get to the ideal size and weight are sold at the local market.  In addition, Adolfo works in agriculture and has his own piece of land where he has mango production.  The loan requested is 1,000 new soles, which will be invested in buying feed for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 22 años, se dedica a la venta de flores, es madre de 2 niños y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, lo que mas le gusta de Finca es el ahorro y las capacitaciones que le dan porque le ayudan a tener una mejor visión, ella trata de poner en práctica todo lo que aprende y ahora esta deseosa de seguir ahorrando para poder construir su casa. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de flores.
texts.en: Dina is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water), she is 22 years old, she has 2 children and she sells flowers. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 4 years, and what she mostly likes about Finca are the savings and the seminars she attends, because they help her having a better retail perspective. She tries to put into practice everything she learns and she wants to keep on saving in order to build her house. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy more flowers.

loans.use: To buy flowers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a picture lamination business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Josephine is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her picture lamination business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her picture lamination business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hats, basins, and brushes to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 64 years old and married with 7 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a business buying and selling copra (dried coconut) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional copra to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Lydia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional copra to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 43 years old and married with 5 children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Milagros aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gladis Matilde

texts.es:
Gladis, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar  productos que le permita mejorar sus ventas, aceite, yuca, maíz, condimentos, quesillo, para mantener y poder aumentar la produccion de pupusas.
El préstamo anterior le genero mas liquidez y compro suficientes materiales para mantener el negocio activo teniendo una fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en: Gladis is requesting a new loan to buy products that allow her to improve her sales, oil, yucca, corn, spices, cheese to keep up and increase the production of pupusas.  The previous loan generated more money and she bought enough ingredients to keep the business active and have a source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, yucca, corn, spices and cheese.

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: Severo, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado,  vive con su nieta  y su esposa  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos para el mantenimiento del café y semilla para hacer un almacigó y las bolsas, e invertir en mono de obra  y así poder obtener el máximo de  producción de la plantación de café y además vender la plantación de almacigo, y con ello poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y de su familia y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Severo is 67 and married.  He currently lives with his granddaughter and wife.  With this loan, he will buy supplies to maintain his coffee crop, to buy seeds to make a seedbed, and to invest in labor to be able to obtain the maximum production from his coffee crop.  He will also sell the seedlings from the seedbed, and he will be able to obtain more profits, resulting in a better quality of life for his family and economic stability.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had a loan with another bank, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seeds to make a seedbed.

loans.name: Italo

texts.es: Ítalo de 32 años vive al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica al mantenimiento y a la reparación de celulares y también a la venta de accesorios derivados de estos productos. Ítalo cuando comenzó su negocio lo hizo comercializando carcazas, cargadores y batería solamente, pero como hizo un curso de reparación y mantenimiento de celulares, agregó este servicio, entendiendo que está muy asociado a su mercado y que anteriormente lo realizaba pero muy deficientemente. Complementando su actividad con la formación logró perfeccionar la técnica hace 7 años y con ello le ha ido muy bien, porque además de lograr ser independiente, ha conseguido ingresos para su sustento personal y el de su familia.. En la actualidad la clientela le pide que adicione la venta de minutos a celulares y como tiene productos que rotan rápidamente, debe tener un inventario de ellos para poder responder oportunamente a sus compradores. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará carcazas, cargadores, display de teléfonos y planes de celulares,  para responder a las solicitudes de su mercado, inversión que por esta razón garantizaría su éxito.
texts.en:
Ítalo is 32, and lives south of the city, where he repairs and maintains cell phones and also sells accessories for these products.  When he began his business, Ítalo did so selling chargers and batteries only. But he took a course in cell phone repair and maintenance and added this service; understanding that it is closely associated with his market, and that he did it previously, but very poorly.

By supplementing his work experience with training, he succeeded in perfecting his skill seven years ago; so things have gone very well, because besides succeeding in being independent, he has earned income to support himself and his family. 

Currently his customers are asking him to add the sale of cell phone minutes. Also, his turnover of products is rapid, so he must have an inventory of them to be able to respond to his buyers in a timely way. This is precisely the reason why he is applying for his credikiva loan, his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

With the loan he will buy cell phone cases, chargers, a telephone display case, and cell phone plans, so that he can respond to the requests of his customers. This is why the investment would assure his success.

loans.use: To buy cell phone cases, chargers, a telephone display case, and cell phone plans.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Loreta has been in this business for 7 years. She also earns more income from fishing. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycles' maintenance. 

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycles' maintenance

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: For her 15th cycle loan, Marciana is borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund her general store business.  This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA and continues to provide her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Lucena works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Lucena is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy new tools, equipment, and additional computers for her internet cafe business.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools, equipment, and additional computers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old and married with one child.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children aged one and eight. She describes herself as aggressive, visionary, and determined. She operates a general store and has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy town and her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Her business goal is to own several such general stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Jeovanny Omar

texts.es:
Jeovany está solicitando un nuevo préstamo  para pagar con anticipación el alquiler del terreno donde se dispone a sembrar maíz y frijol de la temporada de invierno, con este préstamo lograra tener seguridad para empezar su trabajo agrícola.
Con el préstamo anterior el logro realizar la compra de los materiales necesarios para siembra, dándole la cosecha buena, manifiesta que este apoyo ha sido importante para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en: Jeovany is requesting a new loan to pay in advance for the rent of the land where he plans to grow corn and winter beans, with this loan he will be able to secure the plan to start his agricultural work.  With the previous loan he was able to buy the necessary materials to grow crops, it gave him a good harvest and he mentions this support has been important to improve his work.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of his land

loans.name: Gavina Teresa

texts.es: Gavina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 46 años, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada, se dedica a la venta de cuyes y a la crianza de ovejas, vende salchipollo, ella esta muy agradecida a Finca porque le ayudaron a tener una buena formación para mantener un buen negocio. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en alimento para engordar a las ovejas y la otra mitad para comprar papa y pollo.
texts.en: Gavina is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water), she is 46 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She breeds sheep and she sells cuyes (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and salchipollo (fried potatoes served with fried chicken and sauces). She is deeply grateful to Finca because of the good training they have given her, helping her running a good activity. She will use half of the loan she is currently requesting to buy animal feed to fatten her sheep, and the other half to buy potatoes and chicken.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: Mario Ezequiel

texts.es:
Don Mario Ezequiel es originario del municipio de Achuapa donde ha vivido toda su vida, es un padre de familia responsable que ha preparado a todos sus hijos profesionalmente y que hoy son personas independientes y de bien.
En la actualidad solo depende de él su esposa con quien trabajan duramente día a día en su negocio el cual consiste en una Pulpería donde ofrecen todo tipo de abarrotería en general, es un negocio bien surtido y visitado por sus clientes por la variedad de productos y por la amabilidad de sus dueños.
Se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, golosinas, gaseosas y verduras. con el objetivo de surtir más su inventario de productos brindando así un mayor grado de satisfacción a sus clientes, gracias a las utilidades que obtienen de este,  viven dignamente con todas las comodidades en su hogar.
Espera que esta Institución le apoye donde le estará muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Don Mario Ezequiel is a native of the municipality of Achuapa, where he has lived all his life. He is the responsible father of a family who has prepared all his children for careers, and today they are good, independent people.

Now the only one who depends on him is his wife, with whom he works hard day after day in their business, which consists of a grocery store where they offer all types of groceries in general. It is a well-stocked business that is visited by their customers because of the variety of its products and the friendllness of its owners.

He approached Ceprodel for the first time to apply for a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, candies, soft drinks and vegetables, with the objective of increasing his inventory of products, thus offering his customers a higher level of satisfaction. Thanks to the earnings that they obtain, they live with dignity in a home with all the conveniences.

He hopes that this institution will help him, for which he will be very grateful.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, candies, soft drinks, and vegetables for his store

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz de 57 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene un hijo en la edad de 31 años y de profesión abogado. Muy cerca al mar habita y tienen su negocio de miscelánea, donde vende calzado, bolsos,  accesorios femeninos y en general mucha variedad de productos. Su experiencia de negocio la inició desde hace 16 años y ha logrado sostenerla, con su disciplina de trabajo, variedad en sus productos y atención especial a su clientela. Su meta es ampliarla aun más, hasta convertirla en un gran almacén. Ella está muy feliz de tener su miscelánea, pues no tienen que rendirle cuentas a un jefe, a ella le satisface atender a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y amigos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía especial para el día de las madres, como vestidos, calzado, perfumes, colonias, cremas. El éxito de su inversión radica en su experiencia, en que tiene una clientela fiel y además en que se ajusta a la temporada como el día de las madres, época en la cual tradicionalmente hace su mejor venta
texts.en: Beatriz is 57 and lives with her husband.  She has one son who is 31 and is a lawyer.  She lives very close to the ocean and has a general store where she sells shoes, bags, women's accessories, and in general a large variety of products.  She started her business 16 years ago and has managed to sustain it with her work ethic, variety of products, and customer servce.  Her goal is to expand her store even more until it becomes a large department store.  She is very happy about having her store.  She is her own boss, and it satisfies her to attend to her clients, the majority of whom are her friends and neighbors.  Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan.  This is the first financing she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy special merchandise for Mother's Day, like dresses, shoes, perfumes, colognes, and creams.  The success of her investment lies in her experience.  She has a loyal clientele and she also adjusts to the season like for Mother's Day, a time where traditionally she has her best sales.

loans.use: to buy special merchandise for Mother's Day, like dresses, shoes, perfumes, colognes, and creams.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is 42 years old and married with eight children. With five children in school, Neria works very hard to provide for them.

Neria runs a nipa business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.  Nipa are woven palm mats used for house construction and repair.

Neria has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Neria would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es: Teófila es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 55 años, es madre de 8 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 14 años, se dedica a la venta de flores y cereales, Finca le pudo ayudar en al educación  de sus hijos, esta muy agradecida por las capacitaciones que le dan le ayudan a poder tener una noción de como llevar un negocio. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de flores.
texts.en: Teófila is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water), she is 55 years old and she has 8 children. She sells flowers and cereals, and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 14 years, and Finca has been able to help her with the education of her children. She is very grateful for the seminars she attends, as they help her getting ideas about how to run her activity. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy more flowers.

loans.use: To buy flowers.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesús, reside en Masaya, tiene la edad de 39 años, su núcleo familiar es de tres,  él  trabaja  en una empresa que se encarga de comercializar productos de alimentos como carne de pollo, desde hace 14 años. 
Actualmente esta necesitando un crédito para realizar  mejoras en su vivienda la cual consiste en poner ladrillo en  toda la casa. Por lo que esta solicitando a Ceprodel un financiamiento para la compra de cemento, arena, arenilla, ladrillosa así poder realizar sus metas. Y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús lives in Masaya. He is 39 years old. His nuclear familiar consists of three people. He has worked for 14 years in a business that markets food products such as chicken.

At this time he needs a loan to complete some home improvements, which consist of putting bricks on the whole house. For this reason he is applying to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase cement, sand, grit, and bricks to complete his objective and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, grit, and bricks

loans.name: Mileydis

texts.es: Mileydis  de 24 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías que promociona mediante guías especializada de productos y también tiene un punto comercial donde vende útiles escolares y papelería en general. Su negocio inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos adicionales para fortalecer el bienestar de su hogar; fue así como con   ahorros que había hecho desde muy niña, compró su primera vitrina y la surtió. Hoy su clientela se ha extendido y está muy entusiasmada por hacerlo crecer, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr aumentar el volumen de compras de contado, ganar descuentos y ofrecer una mayor variedad de mercancías. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará útiles de papelería, aprovechando que en el sector donde está ubicada no tiene competencia y esto es lo que justamente hace que su credikiva sea exitoso y cumpla con la misión de su negocio que no es otra que la de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mileydis is 24, and lives south of the city with her partner and her 3-year-old son. She sells merchandise that she promotes through specialized product guides, and also has a shop where she sells stationery supplies and stationery in general. 

She started her business because she needed to generate additional income to improve her household's well-being. This is how, with her savings from the time she was very young, she bought her first display case and stocked it. Today her clientele has expanded, and she is very excited to see it grow. 

But her working capital is insufficient for her to manage to increase her volume purchases in cash, in order to earn discounts and offer a greater variety of merchandise. This why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

With the loan, she will buy stationery supplies, taking advantage of the fact that in area where she is located she has no competition. This is precisely what will make her investment succeed and fulfill her business's mission, which is none other than meeting the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Esperanza, tiene 63 años, se dedica la venta de pescado, es madre de 3 hijos, ella estaba en Finca hace 8 años atrás pero tuvo un problema y se retiro, durante ese corto tiempo trato de hacer las cosas como en Finca le habían enseñado, y ahora volvió y ya esta nuevamente en Finca 3 años, esta muy contenta de haber regresado porque le gusta ahorrar y las capacitaciones que son muy útiles para ella. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de pescado.
texts.en: Maria, 63, is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (Love and  Hope) communal bank.  She has 3 children and her business is selling fish.  She was in the Foundation 8 years ago but she had a problem and had to pull out.  During this short period she tried to do the work as Finca had taught her, and she has again joined and has been with Finca for 3 years.  She is very happy that she has returned because she likes to save, and the trainings are very useful for her.  She will use the loan to buy fish.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes de 32 años, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años de edad al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica al comercio de víveres, ranchos, refrescos y productos de la canasta familiar, entre familias que habitan principalmente alrededor de su tienda.  Diomedes inició su negocio desde hace más de dos años en un local arrendado, porque su espíritu emprendedor, lo direccionaba hacia una actividad independiente en la que dejara de ser empleado y llegara a ser su propio jefe, como lo ha logrado en la actualidad, pues gradualmente ha ido comprando herramientas de trabajo, activos fijos, que hoy son de su propiedad. En su negocio vende diariamente y es atendido por él y su cónyuge, ambos tienen como meta futura, comprar el local donde están arrendados. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para cumplir rápidamente sus propósitos, de inversión en los artículos de mayor rotación en la tienda y en mayor cantidad, y poder  disminuir la frecuencia de compras y ganar descuentos por compras en volúmenes, de contado, generando así una mayor   utilidad. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, refrescos y bebidas, productos que vende muy rapidamente y con los que logrará su meta ya mencionada.
texts.en:
Diomedes is 32, and lives south of the city of Barranquilla with his partner and his 10-year-old son. There he has a business selling groceries, snacks, soft drinks, and household products, to families who live mainly around his store. 

Diomedes started his business more than two years ago in a rented locale, because his entrepreneurial spirit directed him toward an independent livelihood, where he could stop being an employee, and be his own boss--which he has now succeeded in doing, as gradually he has bought work equipment and fixed assets that now belong to him. 

He sells every day in his business, which he and his partner run. Both have as their future goal, to buy the shop they rent. Their greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to fulfill their objectives quickly. These are to invest in store items with the highest turnover, buying in greater quantity, and enabling them to decrease the frequency of their purchases and earn volume cash purchase discounts. In this way they can generate higher profits.

This is precisely the reason why he is applying for his credikiva loan, his first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, he will buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks, and other drinks; products that sell very quickly and through which he will achieve the above-mentioned goal.

loans.use: To buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks, and other drinks.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es socio del Banco Comunal Amor y Esperanza, tiene 52, es dueño de una Panadería, es padre de 3 hijos, es socio de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, él aprendió mucho de como llevar bien su negocio y también pudo mejorar su relación familiar, él esta muy bien Finca porque le da capacitación, lo que otras entidades financieras no le dan, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de harina.
texts.en: Luis, 52, has been a member of the Amor y Esperanza (Love and  Hope) communal bank four years.  He has 3 children and owns a bakery  He learned a lot about how to keep his business running well and also how to improve his family relationships.  He is doing well with Finca because of the trainings, something that the other financial institutions don’t offer.  He will use this loan to buy flour.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Esperanza, tiene 53 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de carne, pescado y cachipa, ella esta muy agradecida por las cosas que pudo aprender que le ayudaron para poder tener una noción de cómo se debe llevar un negocio, ahora ella ha progresado mucho y desea poder seguir mejorando, pudo ayudar con la educación de sus hijos, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne para poder llevar a la selva
texts.en: Emilia is a member of the communal bank, "Amor y Esperanza" [Love and Hope].  She is 52 and the mother of 2 children.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for 3 years.  She makes a living by selling meat, fish, and cachipa (artesanal cheese).  She is very thankful for the things she was able to learn that helped her to be able to have an idea like starting a business.  Now she has made a lot of progress, and she wants to be able to keep improving.  She was able to help with her children's education.  Now with this loan, she will invest in the purchase of meat to take to the jungle.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, la casa es familiar, él se dedica al destazo de res y siembra de maíz, desde hace 30 años siembra maíz y hace 10 que se está dedicando al destazo, con estas ocupaciones ha logrado salir a delante con su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la siembra como el abono, herbicidas, tambien comprara dos reces, esto le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas, y con las reces tendrá para el destazo.
La aspiración de José es tener un puesto propio y fijo con el negocio de la carne, porque le permitirá que sus clientes tengan acceso más fácilmente.
texts.en: José lives with his wife and three children.  He makes a living by butchering cattle and growing corn.  He has harvested corn for 30 years and has butchered for 10 years.  With these occupations, he has managed to get ahead with his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for planting like fertilizers and herbicides.  He will also buy two heads of cattle.  This with help him improve the quality of his harvests, and he will have the cattle to butcher.  José's aspiration is to have his own fixed location for his meat business because this will let his customers have easier access to it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and two heads of cattle.

loans.name: Jose Jeremias

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, por el momento no tienen hijos, él se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, realiza las compras y las ventas en el tiangue, tiene ya algunos clientes a quienes compra y vende.
El solicita un préstamo para la invertirlo en la compra de dos novillas, que se las están vendiendo y es un buen negocio, esto le dará a futuro una margen de ganancias que quiere aprovechar.
La aspiración de José es desarrollarse con su negocio, aportando más a su familia y un día crecer en ella junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife. At the present time, they have no children. His work is selling livestock. He makes his purchases and sales in El Tiangue. He already has several customers to whom he sells and from whom he buys.

He is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of two steers that are being sold and that will be a good deal. In the future this will give him a good profit margin, which he wants to take advantage of.

José's aspiration is to develop in his business, contribute more to his family, and someday, with his wife, make it larger.

loans.use: to buy two steers

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es: Emilce de 50 años tiene un taller de confecciones en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar donde vive con sus tres  hijas en las edades de 9, 16 y 21 años. Ella tiene un taller de confecciones desde cuando adquirió su primera máquina hace 20 años y empezó a confeccionar para sus amigas, vestidos, blusas y faldas. Gradualmente su mercado empezó a crecer y con ello las posibilidades de vender otros productos como calzado, colonias, ropa informal, para generar mas ingresos y generar bienestar a su hogar.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización en la que tienen un año de estar vinculada y con la que ha logrado tener un capital de trabajo para atender nuevos pedidos y ganar un poco mas. Con su credikiva, comprará una nueva máquina de coser, porque necesita aumentar su productividad y mejorar la calidad de las prendas, teniendo en cuenta que quiere abordar mercados mas estructurados. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su negocio, adecuando su infraestructura de máquinas y logrando la vinculación de operarias que apoyen sus procesos productivos y generen ingresos que las beneficien.
texts.en: Emilce, 50, has a dressmaking shop in Puerto Colombia, very close to the sea, where she lives with her three daughters, 9, 16 and 21.  She has had the shop since she got her first sewing machine 20 years ago and began to make dresses, blouses and skirts for her friends.  Gradually her market began to grow and with it, the possibility of selling other products such as shoes, perfumes, and casual clothing  to generate more income and help with the welfare of her household.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her second financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She has been a member of this organization for a year and with it has succeeded in having working capital to cover new orders and to earn a little more.  She will use the Kiva loan to buy a new sewing machine because she needs to increase her productivity and to improve the quality of her clothing.  This is because she wants to get involved with more structured markets.
